Content: World's best 51% security is only with spawning own chain and dPoW it with. No other blockchain gives that level of assurance...

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: 1) proof of concepts,  application may not need all the functionality and cost of a forked chain. 2)   Multiple functionalities that would have be added in or adapted into the forked chain that can be added in very easily with assetchain generation( cryptoconditions ) , also lower overhead for getting a secure blockchain up,  DPoW gives the 51% protection , notaries have run nodes which increase decentralization.  Also many products essential to getting a coin off the ground are already built around rapid assetchain addition  like the multicoin wallet or atomic swaps.   Starting a assetchain would put you months ahead in work completed compared to a freshly forked chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no idea about tezos, but yes this is open source and why indeed would anybody build on an expensive blockchain and subject to paying that coin as fees forever? with komodo chains they get the best of both worlds, instant jump start to development, unique ability to create a custom consensus baked into the blockchain, and have total control over their coin/project. There is no KMD tax. Asking how KMD benefits without any direct taxation, is like asking how countries with low to no tax end up with a disproportionate amount of business

Author: artik123#2884
Content:
@grewalsatinder I specifically chose a PoS project. 
Lets say average joe doesn't have a clue about crypto attack vectors, he only cares about the cost and he trusts the killer app guy that has a the beginning 100% of the stake. 
later on, as the app succeed, app guy holding goes down to lets say 30% (which make it safer for everybody). 
People, even in the cryptoworld, already trust PoS systems (with the possibility of 51% attack) with billions of dollars so it's not an issue anymore.

Author: artik123#2884
Content:
@polycryptoblog forking a coin costs him nothing, PoS nodes also cost almost nothing, he could also fork almost everything he wishes (such as other smart contracts that he needs, explorer etc.) 
from a mature ecosystem functionalities, as I replied to grewal it will get more decentralized with time.

Content:
@jl777c It was just an example for a PoS project. thats why I mentioned forking... it's almost costless, he has an instant jump to copy everything he needs from the original project ecosystem for his own project and 
also have full control over his project (and no congestions on the blockchain) and low fees. he gets the benefits of a mature ecosystem and no taxations.
